Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of NeuroPort™ Microelectrode Array in Epilepsy Monitoring

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved seven patients undergoing subdural electrode implantation for epilepsy monitoring.

Participants.evidence: Participants were eligible if they required epilepsy monitoring and were implanted with the NeuroPort™ MEA in putative non-eloquent epileptogenic cortex.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were eligible if they required epilepsy monitoring and were implanted with the NeuroPort™ MEA in putative non-eloquent epileptogenic cortex.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the successful recording of LFPs and single-unit activity over 3–28 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved seven patients undergoing subdural electrode implantation for epilepsy monitoring.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Robust and durable LFPs and single-unit recordings were obtained from all individuals.

Harms.evidence: No neurological complications or infections were associated with electrode implantation or monitoring.
